title: Universal Aspects of Two-Dimensional Yang-Mills Theory at Large N
abstract: We show that the large N partition functions and Wilson loop observables of two-dimensional Yang-Mills theories admit a universal functional form irrespective of the gauge group. We demonstrate that U(N) QCD_2 undergoes a large N, third-order phase transition on the projective plane at an area-coupling product of \pi^2/2. We use this as a lemma to provide a direct transcription of the partition functions and phase portraits of Yang-Mills theory from the U(N) on RP^2 at large N to the other classical Lie groups on S^2. We compute the expectation value of the Wilson loops in the fundamental representation for SO(N) and Sp(N) on the two sphere. Finally we compare the strong- and weak-coupling limit of these expressions with those found elswhere in the literature.
